title.narrative: Justice for all 2017-2020, An Integrated Project for Human Rights Protection...

description.narrative:
Ethiopia has registered a number of economic milestones and achievements and has made remarkable steps with respect to human rights protection in terms of legislation rather than full implementation.
Studies and surveys show that in Ethiopia, there are considerable gaps in fulfilling the human rights obligations and take different forms, such us treatment of detainees in prison/detention centers which is far from the international minimum standard rules and practices. Other forms of violation includes arbitrary arrest, prolonged pre-trail detention and detention centers. Some of those weaknesses are exacerbated by widespread lack of human rights awareness by the law enforcement bodies and lack of commitment to observe their human rights obligations and prevalence of rule of law.
The intervention entails activities on enhancing capacity of the legislative, executive and judiciary bodies in addition to advocacy works, researches, experience sharing and lobbying for improved policy, legislative and institutional environment and increased human rights friendly prosecution systems. The project proposes partnerships with a wide range of actors spanning from government institutions to media and civil society groups. Working closely with the government will be necessary in order to achieve the desired changes. At the same time the proposal points out many challenges such as rapid turnover of staff, scarcity of public resources, power issues, lack of political will and institutional conservatism. The conclusion is that the organization has demonstrated enough capacity and expertise to continue the momentum of their results in the Justice sector.

Etiopien har registrerat ett antal ekonomiska milstolpar och landvinningar och har tagit anmärkningsvärda steg när det gäller skydd av mänskliga rättigheter i form av lagstiftning snarare än fullständigt genomförande.
Studier och undersökningar visar att det i Etiopien finns avsevärda luckor i att uppfylla de mänskliga rättigheternas skyldigheter och ta sig olika former, till exempel behandling av fångar i fängelser/fängelser som är långt ifrån de internationella minimistandardreglerna och praxis. Andra former av kränkning inkluderar godtyckliga arresteringar, förlängt frihetsberövande före spår och interneringscenter. En del av dessa svagheter förvärras av en utbredd brist på medvetenhet om mänskliga rättigheter från de brottsbekämpande organen och bristande engagemang för att iaktta sina skyldigheter för mänskliga rättigheter och förekomsten av rättsstatsprincipen.
Insatsen omfattar aktiviteter för att stärka kapaciteten hos de lagstiftande, verkställande och rättsliga organen utöver opinionsbildning, forskning, erfarenhetsutbyte och lobbying för förbättrad politik, lagstiftning och institutionell miljö och ökade människorättsvänliga åtalssystem. Projektet föreslår partnerskap med ett brett spektrum av aktörer som sträcker sig från statliga institutioner till media och civilsamhällesgrupper. Ett nära samarbete med regeringen kommer att vara nödvändigt för att uppnå önskade förändringar. Samtidigt pekar förslaget på många utmaningar som snabb personalomsättning, brist på offentliga resurser, maktfrågor, bristande politisk vilja och institutionell konservatism. Slutsatsen är att organisationen har visat tillräckligt med kapacitet och kompetens att fortsätta drivkraften i sina resultat inom rättsväsendet.

The overall objective of this project is to contribute to the enhancement of status of human rights, good governance, peace and the rule of law. There is no major change in the objective of the project; however, a rather specific objective has been added. Even thought the target group remains the same, there is an additional objective of enhancing the role of the target group (law enforcement organs) in undertaking a free, fair preaceful election and a people controlled democracy and transition in Ethiopia.

description.narrative: As with most partners, 2020 has been difficult for JFA-PFE. The partner had to struggle with both Covid related restrictions and restrictions based on ongoing conflicts in the country. Despite these challenges, the partner managed to achieve results. To highlight a few: - JFA-PFE allocated ETB. 1,050,000.00 (One Million fifty thousand) as emergency budget for purpose of combating COVID-19 pandemic in Ethiopian prisons. The financial support was made to the federal and all regional states’ prison administration commission – (except Somali Region) and for the procurement of personal protective material including sanitizer, alcohol, face mask and soap. - Justice for all has been supporting efforts to enhance freedom of expression and freedom of the media. In the current budget year JFA-PFE, supported development of the code of conduct for media professionals and court reporting manual per the demand of the Ethiopian Broadcast Authority. - JFA-PFE together with Inter-Religious Council and National Elders has also organized an initiative where these groups have went to Mekelle to attempt to soften the tension between the Tigray Region and The Federal Government. - The other activity undertaken is clearance of backlog cases of courts’ so as to improve protection of suspects right through speedy trial and reduced length of pretrial detentions. The initial plan was clearing 10,000 cases but was later revised to 13,149 which was further raised to 14,933. It was possible to resolve 17,320 backlog files during the court recess period in the Federal and Regional Supreme courts with is an accomplishment of 116%. - Training beneficiary is civil society organization. Following the adoption of the new Civil Society Proclamation the agency requested JFA-PFE to support technically and financially its effort to build the capacity of the Agency. Accordingly, training was organized in collaboration with the agency for 76 staffs of the Agency in two rounds.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
